description: A 2D greenhouse farming RPG where players control a character managing tomato plants through physical exploration, manual tasks, and strategic worker hiring

tasks.title: Initialize Godot Project Structure
tasks.description: As a developer, I need the basic Godot 4.x project structure set up so we can start building the game.
acceptanceCriteria: project.godot file configured with correct settings
Directory structure created (scenes/, scripts/, prefabs/, assets/, tests/)
Main scene (main.tscn) created and set as default
Basic window settings configured (1152x648 resolution, canvas_items stretch)
Project runs without errors in Godot editor

tasks.title: Create Simulation Core Singleton
tasks.description: As a player, I need a simulation engine that tracks temperature and humidity so environmental conditions can be monitored and modified.
acceptanceCriteria: simulation_core.gd created as an Autoload singleton
Temperature tracking with getter/setter (float, Celsius)
Humidity tracking with getter/setter (float, percentage 0-100)
Signals emitted when values change: temperature_changed, humidity_changed
Time-based decay system for natural condition drift
Unit tests for core simulation logic (test_simulation_core.gd)

tasks.title: Build Environment Stats UI
tasks.description: As a player, I need to see current temperature and humidity on screen so I can make informed decisions about equipment usage.
acceptanceCriteria: UI scene created (environment_ui.tscn)
Temperature display with clear visual indicator
Humidity display with clear visual indicator
Real-time updates when simulation values change
UI positioned clearly on screen (top corner or sidebar)
Visual feedback when values are outside optimal ranges

tasks.title: Implement Equipment Base System
tasks.description: As a developer, I need a base equipment class so all greenhouse equipment follows a consistent interface.
acceptanceCriteria: EquipmentBase class created in scripts/equipment_base.gd
Properties: energy_cost (float), active (bool)
Methods: activate(), deactivate(), can_activate(), _on_activate(), _on_deactivate()
Equipment can only activate if can_activate() returns true
Signal emitted when equipment state changes
Unit tests for equipment base functionality

tasks.title: Create Player Character with Movement
tasks.description: As a player, I need a character I can control to walk around the greenhouse and interact with objects.
acceptanceCriteria: Player scene created with CharacterBody2D
Movement using WASD or arrow keys
Sprite animation (idle, walk) with 4 directions
Collision detection with greenhouse boundaries
Camera follows player smoothly
Unit tests for movement logic

tasks.title: Create Greenhouse Tilemap with Y-Sorting
tasks.description: As a player, I need a visual greenhouse environment with proper depth so my character can walk inside and outside naturally.
acceptanceCriteria: Tilemap scene with inside and outside areas
Greenhouse walls with entrance/exit
Y-sorting configured for proper depth rendering
Floor tiles (concrete inside, grass/dirt outside)
Plant benches positioned inside greenhouse
Placeholder pixel art style consistent with Stardew Valley

tasks.title: Implement Proximity Interaction System
tasks.description: As a player, I need to interact with equipment and objects by walking near them and pressing a key.
acceptanceCriteria: Interaction detection within 2-tile radius
Highlight/interaction indicator appears when near interactables
Press 'E' or space to interact
Interaction menu/context appears on interaction
Works with all equipment types
Unit tests for interaction detection

tasks.title: Create Physical Equipment Stations
tasks.description: As a player, I need equipment placed in the world as physical objects I can walk to and interact with.
acceptanceCriteria: Heat pump station placed outside
Fan and Vent stations placed on greenhouse walls
Irrigation control panel inside greenhouse
Water tank placed outside
Each station has sprite and collision
Stations show status (active/inactive) visually

tasks.title: Implement Equipment Control Interface
tasks.description: As a player, when I interact with equipment, I need a UI to check status, set values, and toggle on/off.
acceptanceCriteria: Equipment interaction UI appears on interaction
Shows current status (temperature/humidity being affected)
Toggle button to activate/deactivate
Slider/input to set target values
Shows energy consumption and cost
Close button to return to game

tasks.title: Add Equipment Maintenance System
tasks.description: As a player, I need to check if equipment is broken and repair it, or hire workers to do so.
acceptanceCriteria: Equipment can break randomly based on usage
Broken equipment shows visual indicator (sparks, smoke)
Player can interact to check status (working/broken)
Repair mini-game or cost to fix
Broken equipment doesn't function until repaired
Unit tests for breakage probability

tasks.title: Create Tomato Plant System
tasks.description: As a player, I want tomato plants I can physically tend to by walking to them and performing actions.
acceptanceCriteria: TomatoPlant class with growth stages
Plants placed on benches inside greenhouse
Visual sprites for each stage (seedling to harvest)
Player can interact with plants to view status
Shows current health and growth progress
Unit tests for growth logic

tasks.title: Implement Manual Plant Tasks
tasks.description: As a player, I need to perform manual tasks on plants like pruning, watering, and transplanting.
acceptanceCriteria: Pruning: Remove dead leaves to improve growth rate
Watering: Manual water application using can/tank
Transplanting: Move seedlings to larger pots
Each task requires walking to plant and interacting
Tasks take time (progress bar or animation)
Tasks can be done by player or assigned to workers

tasks.title: Create Economy and Money System
tasks.description: As a player, I need money to pay for equipment operation, repairs, and worker wages.
acceptanceCriteria: Money system singleton tracking player funds
Equipment operation costs money over time
Selling tomatoes earns money
Repair costs deducted from funds
Worker wages paid periodically
UI showing current money (top-right corner)

tasks.title: Implement Worker Hiring System
tasks.description: As a player, I can hire workers to automate tasks like equipment monitoring and plant care.
acceptanceCriteria: Worker hub/interface to view and hire workers
Different worker types: Technician (repairs), Gardener (plant care), Manager (equipment)
Workers have daily wages and skill levels
Assign workers to specific tasks or zones
Workers walk around and perform tasks automatically
Can fire workers to stop paying wages

tasks.title: Add Sensor and Monitoring Stations
tasks.description: As a player, I need to walk to sensor stations to check detailed environmental readings.
acceptanceCriteria: Temperature and humidity sensors placed around greenhouse
Sensor station shows detailed readings when interacted
Shows min/max values and trends
Can adjust sensor alert thresholds
Visual indicator if readings are out of range
Workers can monitor sensors and alert player

tasks.title: Implement Win/Lose and Progression
tasks.description: As a player, I need clear goals: grow and sell tomatoes while managing costs, or lose by going bankrupt or killing plants.
acceptanceCriteria: Win condition: Harvest and sell 10 tomatoes with profit
Lose condition: All plants die OR money drops below 0
Progress tracking (tomatoes grown, money earned)
Day/night cycle affecting gameplay
Game over screen with restart option
Optional: Multiple difficulty levels

tasks.title: Add Visual Polish and Audio
tasks.description: As a player, I want the game to feel complete with animations, sound effects, and music.
acceptanceCriteria: Character walk animations (4 directions)
Equipment animations (spinning fan, flowing water)
Sound effects: footsteps, equipment hum, UI clicks
Background music (cozy farming sim style)
Particle effects (steam, water drops, sparkles)
Day/night lighting changes

tasks.title: Configure Web Export
tasks.description: As a developer, I need the game configured for web export so it can be easily shared and played in browsers.
acceptanceCriteria: Export template configured for Web platform
export_presets.cfg created with web settings
Game exports successfully to HTML5
All scenes and resources included in export
Tested in browser (Chrome/Firefox)
Responsive scaling for different screen sizes
